tables.table_schema: Agents can use the SQL database to schedule and prioritize customer callback requests.
Agents (agent_id INT, name VARCHAR(255), email VARCHAR(255), phone_number VARCHAR(20))
CallbackRequests (request_id INT, customer_name VARCHAR(255), requested_at TIMESTAMP, priority ENUM('High', 'Medium', 'Low'), agent_id INT)

CREATE TABLE callback_requests (
    request_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT NOT NULL,
    request_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    priority INT DEFAULT 1,
    status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'Pending',
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
);
Agents (agent_id INT, name VARCHAR(50), email VARCHAR(50), phone_number VARCHAR(15))
Customers (customer_id INT, name VARCHAR(50), email VARCHAR(50), phone_number VARCHAR(15))
CallbackRequests (request_id INT, customer_id INT, agent_id INT, request_time TIMESTAMP, priority INT)
Callbacks (callback_id INT, request_id INT, agent_id INT, callback_time TIMESTAMP, status VARCHAR(20))
AgentAvailability (agent_id INT, available BOOLEAN, start_time TIME, end_time TIME)
